fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Customs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Digital economy and society, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives:
I work to write standardization rules on: 
CEN/TC434 e-invoicing,  
CEN/TC440 e-procurement, 
and national body UNINFO: 
UNI/CT510 "Signs, Label, identity, and trust services". 
UNI/CT522 "eBusiness and financial services"  
UNI/CT526 "standardization rules for professionals on security and privacy sector"  
UNI/CT532  "Blockchain Distributed Ledger Technology" 
UNI/CT500 "IoT and Industry 4.0" 
UNI/CT533 “Artificial Intelligence - AI"
membership:
Italian accountancy profession (chartered accountant) in Italy, brief presentation of profession at http://www.cndcec.it/Portal/Documenti/Dettaglio.aspx?id=e6f3d4de-1aaf-4ede-bced-0ad72c2eb28d 
 
UNINFO is federated body of UNI (National Body of the standardization) on ICT matters at national and international level. It represents Italy at ISO, ISO/IEC JTC 1, CEN and European Commission. UNI is recognized by the European Union (article 27 Regulation (UE) n. 1025/2012) - http://www.uninfo.it/
goals__remit:
Italian accountancy profession (chartered accountant). 
Consultant on organization of private companies and public authorities on digital management of processes and documents. 
Expert uf UNINFO* and, for this reason, I’m collaborator in AGID (Italian Agency for the Digital Agenda) and I participate at various technical workgroups and workshops on eIDAS, e-invoicing, e-procurement and other activities. 
I'm also a member of: 
- CEN-CENELEC Focus Group on Blockchain DLT, 
- UN/CEFACT Working Group on Blockchain Whitepaper UNECE (United Nations Economic Commission for Europe), 
- Focus Group on Application of Distributed Ledger Technology at ITU (International Telecommunication Union), 
- CEN/TC434 and CEN/TC440, 
- Expert Group at EMSFEI - CEN for the development of the European standard for the "Core Invoice" CEN/TC434 in application of Directive 2014/55 / ​​EU 
- Advisory Group at the Connecting Europe Facility - CEF for the development of the "Match-making Website" for Public Administrations. 
 
 
(*) UNINFO is federated body of UNI (National Body of the standardization) on ICT matters at national and international level. It represents Italy at ISO, ISO/IEC JTC 1, CEN and European Commission. UNI is recognized by the European Union (article 27 Regulation (UE) n. 1025/2012).
